846d3b0e-b834-41e3-a668-e36f5236a1e7.description: The Freedom Seal’s proprietary Associate Certification provides practical skills that enable you to conduct thoughtful assessments. Freedom Seal Associate Certification recipients are known for their full view of financial and trafficking crimes, including modern-day slavery, a working knowledge. Receiving Freedom Seal Associate Certification demonstrates your commitment to social justice and reducing inequalities through identifying indicators associated with forced labor and financial crimes.
846d3b0e-b834-41e3-a668-e36f5236a1e7.name: Freedom Seal IPC Associate

issuer.summary: issued by Freedom Seal Global Inc.

alignments.name: Professional Certification Program
alignments.description: Topics covered and evaluated in the certification program: (all specific to modern slavery and human trafficking from a general and human rights point of view) general aspects of modern slavery and human trafficking human trafficking in global manufacturing and the supply chain modern slavery in specific industries: financial, manufacturing,

badge_template_activities.title: As part of our certification solutions, Freedom Seal Global has developed an Individual Professional Certification, the first of three stages of its Individual Certification Program, aimed at individuals and professionals who want to acquire, or show proof of, general knowledge on the issue of Forced Labor and Human Rights.

Our Clients will learn how to apply general knowledge and practical aspects to prevent forced labor in the supply chains our Theoretical general content includes but not limited to the following: different forms of modern-day slavery, definitions of main concepts, statistics and numbers, human trafficking, forced labor, labor recruitment, subcontracting, high risk sectors and products, modern slavery in the financial industry, international initiatives, stakeholders’

skills.name: Financial Vulnerability As A Driver Of Modern Slavery

06e3c7b8-4168-47e4-aab0-0c666315491d.description: The Platinum Freedom Seal Leader level is reserved for those select companies that (1) qualify for the Silver and Gold Freedom Seal, and (2) taken the additional step of conducting a risk-based audit of their key suppliers to help ensure that their supply chain is not only free of modern-day slavery and human rights abuses, but also has a strong impact on workers and the community.
06e3c7b8-4168-47e4-aab0-0c666315491d.name: Freedom Seal Fair Labor Certified

issuer.summary: issued by Freedom Seal Global Inc.

alignments.name: FORCED LABOR CERTIFICATION
alignments.description: We assess a company’s efforts to address forced labor risks in their operations and supply chains. We provide Certification to businesses at the corporate level from different industries that demonstrate they have adequate risk management measures in place related to Modern-Day Slavery.

badge_template_activities.title: FSG’s certification team will evaluate the audited areas against certification guidelines, consisting of detailed questions, which were developed by FSG in consultation with experts in the field.  The due diligence process involves an examination of publicly available information, information provided by the company, and documented interviews (or on-site visits, if necessary) with the Company’s management team and/or board members, to evidence the Company’s efforts in managing risks.

skills.name: Evidence Of Managing Risks Through A Companies Policies And Operations
Publicly Available Statement On A Company's Website

dc4bc3ee-8906-4634-af52-879271986f71.description: Based on your company’s industry, existing governance and regulatory environment, you may require a tailored program to meet your current needs, to integrate appropriate policies and commitments into your business operations. Recognizing this, Freedom Seal has developed three types of certification programs to meet the needs of companies. Focuses on corporate business practices from a human rights due diligence perspective.
dc4bc3ee-8906-4634-af52-879271986f71.name: Freedom Seal Human Rights

issuer.summary: issued by Freedom Seal Global Inc.

alignments.name: Freedom Seal Human Rights Standards
alignments.description: The Freedom Seal’s objective is to determine whether a company has in place a due diligence process in human rights directed towards effectively managing its negative human rights impact risks according to widely accepted international standards. This Certification is NOT directed towards certifying a company’s actual human rights practices.

badge_template_activities.title: The integration of the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights into other leading responsible business standards, such as the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises, has helped raise awareness and understanding of responsible human rights risk management, providing an approach to pragmatic and meaningful governance processes that support all ESG-related activities.

skills.name: Commitment To Respect Internationally Recognized Human Rights
